pageContext.claim: “Honduras, Guatemala and El Salvador are doing nothing for the United States but taking our money. Word is that a new Caravan is forming in Honduras and they are doing nothing about it. We will be cutting off all aid to these 3 countries - taking advantage of U.S. for years!”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. has given substantial foreign aid to Hondurus, Guatemala and El Salvador over the last several years, but it has declined dramatically since Trump took office. All three countries were only allocated $88 million dollars in aid in 2018, down from a combined total of $499 million in 2016. (That increased to $186 million in Fiscal 2019.) The aid is intended to improve the economy and government functions in these countries, in the hopes that lives will improve for citizens and fewer will feel the need to flee. In fact, Trump's claims appears to contradict an announcement by the State Department on Dec. 18, 2018 that, along with Mexico, the United States will boost aid to these countries to promote "a safer and more prosperous Central America."
